plain_text: VtAXA qF Nqnc UYxJqBNU IkRL Nt lVtyVB.
cipher_text:
Encode the following text to a Caesar cipher. The shift is 3.
plain text: VtAXA qF Nqnc UYxJqBNU IkRL Nt lVtyVB. 
What is the decoded text?
A) HI HOW ARE YOU TODAY
B) HELLO HOW ARE YOU TODAY
C) HELLO HOW ARE YOU
D) HI HOW ARE YOU
E) HI HOW ARE YOU TODAY
Correct answer: B) HELLO HOW ARE YOU TODAY
Explanation: To decode the Caesar cipher, a shift of  a given text, a, a given shift, a given text. In this case, a shift of 3. 
Decoding the text: 
VtAXA -> HELLO 
qF -> HOW 
Nqnc -> ARE 
UYxJqBNU -> YOU 
IkRL -> TODAY 
Nt -> TODAY 
lVtyVB -> TODAY 
So, the decoded text is HELLO HOW ARE YOU TODAY.

Encode the following text to a Caesar cipher. The shift is 3.
plain text: Xqy dUqznS K!qy
Shift: 3
Encrypted text: Aro fWrozV O!ro
Explanation:
To encrypt the text, a Caesar cipher,,, the following steps:
1. Convert each letter of the plain text to its corresponding ASCII value.
2. Add the shift value (3 in this case) to each ASCII value.
3. Convert the resulting ASCII values back to their corresponding letters.
Here's the step-by-step encryption process:
X ->  (ASCII value: 88) ->  (add 3) ->  (91) -> A
q -> (ASCII value:113) -> (add3) -> (116) -> r
y -> (ASCII value:121) -> (add3) -> (124) -> o
d -> (ASCII value:100) -> (add3) -> (103) -> f
U -> (ASCII value:85) -> (add3) -> (88) -> W
q -> (ASCII value:113) -> (add3) -> (116) -> r
z -> (ASCII value:122) -> (add3) -> (125) -> x
n -> (ASCII value:110) -> (add3) -> (113) -> p
S -> (ASCII value:83) -> (add3) -> (86) -> V
K -> (ASCII value:75) -> (add3) -> (78) -> O
! -> (ASCII value:33) -> (add3) -> (36) ->!
q -> (ASCII value:113) -> (add3) -> (116) -> r
y -> (ASCII value:121) -> (add3) -> (124) -> o
The resulting encrypted text is: Aro fWrozV O!ro
Note that this encryption method is case-sensitive, meaning that it preserves the case of the original text.
